quote: If one does not know to which port one is sailing, no wind is favorable.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect.
author: Mark Twain

quote: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.
author: Colin Powell

quote: Our work is the presentation of our capabilities.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: If you owe the bank $100 that's your problem. If you owe the bank $100 million, that's the bank's problem.
author: J. Paul Getty

quote: There is only one boss. The customer. And he can fire everybody in the company from the chairman on down, simply by spending his money somewhere else.
author: Sam Walton

quote: Happiness does not come from doing easy work but from the afterglow of satisfaction that comes after the achievement of a difficult task that demanded our best.
author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

quote: A brand for a company is like a reputation for a person. You earn reputation by trying to do hard things well.
author: Jeff Bezos

quote: Making money is art and working is art and good business is the best art.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: If you're trying to create a company, it's like baking a cake. You have to have all the ingredients in the right proportion.
author: Elon Musk

quote: It is not from the benevolence of the butcher, the brewer, or the baker that we expect our dinner, but from their regard to their own interest.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: Details create the big picture.
author: Sanford I. Weill

quote: An organization, no matter how well designed, is only as good as the people who live and work in it.
author: Dee Hock

quote: In the business world, everyone is paid in two coins: cash and experience. Take the experience first; the cash will come later.
author: Harold S. Geneen

quote: An economist is an expert who will know tomorrow why the things he predicted yesterday didn't happen today.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: Ideas pull the trigger, but instinct loads the gun.
author: Don Marquis

quote: Sooner or later, those who win are those who think they can.
author: Paul Tournier

quote: The entrepreneur always searches for change, responds to it, and exploits it as an opportunity.
author: Peter Drucker

quote: Do more than is required. What is the distance between someone who achieves their goals consistently and those who spend their lives and careers merely following? The extra mile.
author: Gary Ryan Blair

quote: The first responsibility of a leader is to define reality. The last is to say thank you. In between, the leader is a servant.
author: Max de Pree

quote: Economic depression cannot be cured by legislative action or executive pronouncement. Economic wounds must be healed by the action of the cells of the economic body - the producers and consumers themselves.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: Just because something doesn't do what you planned it to do doesn't mean it's useless.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: A company is only as good as the people it keeps.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: An organization's ability to learn, and translate that learning into action rapidly, is the ultimate competitive advantage.
author: Jack Welch

quote: The superior man understands what is right; the inferior man understands what will sell.
author: Confucius

quote: One of the tests of leadership is the ability to recognize a problem before it becomes an emergency.
author: Arnold H. Glasow

quote: Don't worry about people stealing your ideas. If your ideas are any good, you'll have to ram them down people's throats.
author: Howard Aiken

quote: Effort only fully releases its reward after a person refuses to quit.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: It's not what you pay a man, but what he costs you that counts.
author: Will Rogers

quote: A business that makes nothing but money is a poor business.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Failure doesn't mean you are a failure it just means you haven't succeeded yet.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: It's easy to make a buck. It's a lot tougher to make a difference.
author: Tom Brokaw

quote: I rate enthusiasm even above professional skill.
author: Edward Appleton

quote: When in doubt, mumble; when in trouble, delegate; when in charge, ponder.
author: James H. Boren

quote: Ask five economists and you'll get five different answers - six if one went to Harvard.
author: Edgar Fiedler

quote: Some people regard private enterprise as a predatory tiger to be shot. Others look on it as a cow they can milk. Not enough people see it as a healthy horse, pulling a sturdy wagon.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Almost all quality improvement comes via simplification of design, manufacturing... layout, processes, and procedures.
author: Tom Peters

quote: No enterprise is more likely to succeed than one concealed from the enemy until it is ripe for execution.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: To command is to serve, nothing more and nothing less.
author: Andre Malraux

quote: So little done, so much to do.
author: Cecil Rhodes

quote: Try, try, try, and keep on trying is the rule that must be followed to become an expert in anything.
author: W. Clement Stone

quote: The way to get things done is not to mind who gets the credit for doing them.
author: Benjamin Jowett

quote: The work of the individual still remains the spark that moves mankind ahead even more than teamwork.
author: Igor Sikorsky

quote: If you don't drive your business, you will be driven out of business.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: I hope we shall crush in its birth the aristocracy of our monied corporations which dare already to challenge our government to a trial by strength, and bid defiance to the laws of our country.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Meetings are indispensable when you don't want to do anything.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: Success or failure in business is caused more by the mental attitude even than by mental capacities.
author: Walter Scott

quote: The final test of a leader is that he leaves behind him in other men the conviction and the will to carry on.
author: Walter Lippmann

quote: Corporation: An ingenious device for obtaining profit without individual responsibility.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: If you want to kill any idea in the world, get a committee working on it.
author: Charles Kettering

quote: And while the law of competition may be sometimes hard for the individual, it is best for the race, because it ensures the survival of the fittest in every department.
author: Andrew Carnegie

quote: Carpe per diem - seize the check.
author: Robin Williams

quote: Business, more than any other occupation, is a continual dealing with the future; it is a continual calculation, an instinctive exercise in foresight.
author: Henry R. Luce

quote: Business is a combination of war and sport.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: Our business is infested with idiots who try to impress by using pretentious jargon.
author: David Ogilvy

quote: If you cannot work with love but only with distaste, it is better that you should leave your work.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: Disneyland is a work of love. We didn't go into Disneyland just with the idea of making money.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Regard it as just as desirable to build a chicken house as to build a cathedral.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: The great leaders are like the best conductors - they reach beyond the notes to reach the magic in the players.
author: Blaine Lee
